page.title: 18LEIGHTON HOSPITAL
page.content: They began building the hospital in 1972 and had finished it by the time it was opened by{Queen Elizabeth the {Second}in April 1972. Immediately it was opened the hospital went on strike, and some of the pupils of our school who were born there at that time, were kept in cots covered with paper towels since there were no sheets. The hospital is a very big place with many corridors and stairs, and there are always lots of people around. It is painted a sort of creamy colour, and besides the wards, contains a shop where you can buy confectionary. There are many wards; one for the children, one for elderley patients, and one especially for mentally disturbed patients. The corridors seem to stretch endlessly on.
